review: Saturday.... you wanna get some shopping and a good meal in DTLA ???? I found my need for shopping therapy and good food with a warm fuzzy feeling when I decided to eat at CPK. Darrin looked professional, clean and shaved.  I say this, because I see some service employees looking like they just got to work with a shower or a shave.  Thank you Darrin, your smile and service was sincere and good.  You see, when I walked in- I did not know what I wanted to eat... I left up to him... and they choice was awesome. Shrimp Scampi Pizza wow! and I did indulge in a piece of cheesecake, had to get the Pumpkin fix.  Loved it, and I will come back and enjoy a truly good experience on my truly precious Saturdays!

I really enjoyed my time at this CPK it is a great location with great service! Our server Javier was nice, funny, and attentive, so he definitely made it enjoyable for us! I came here with my boyfriend and his family and we were starving after walking around DTLA, so we ordered a bunch of food to share! Our server started us of with some recommendations and we and decided to order the recommend Sangria Flight! It comes with three different flavors and I enjoyed each one! My favorite was the Beehive Sangria, though. The alcohol was not strong at all and I would definitely want to order the full sized one after trying it out. For appetizers we ordered the White Corn Guacamole + Chips, the Brussels + Bacon Flatbread, the Crispy Mac 'N' Cheese, and a Full Classic Caesar Salad! That's a lot of food... the appetizers I enjoyed the most were the Brussels + Bacon Flatbread and the Crispy Mac 'N' Cheese! I was actually really surprised at home much I liked the flatbread because I usually don't like brussel sprouts, but I loved how they tasted with the bacon on the flatbread. As for the Crispy Mac 'N' Cheese I ALWAYS order it whenever I go to CPK because of how much I love mac 'n' cheese and they always taste so good! I hope they never get rid of it on their menu! We also ordered the Sicilian Crispy Thin Crust Pizza and it was really good! I've ordered it before at other CPK's and I always enjoy how it comes out!  At this point I was already really full, but then found out that I could redeem one free dessert because I am a CPK rewards member and it was my birthday this month! And I went through and redeemed the offer and ordered the Key Lime Pie, which only covers desserts for free without including ice cream. So, if you wanted to order a dessert that is offered with ice cream you would have to pay the extra if you wanted to include ice cream with it. Which to me is a bit weird, but whatever it's still a free dessert! The Key Lime Pie was really yummy, but I think I would have enjoyed it more if I wasn't so full, haha!  Glad we stopped by here to eat instead of hunting down the food trucks that we saw earlier in the day! I left full and happy!

I've been to CPK's before and I'd rate them 3 or 4 stars had I used Yelp back then. This location however amazed me with their service! The waiter that took our orders is named Javier. Really cool guy! He started by recommending drinks while we looked through the menu. My mom and sister were in the mood for wine so we took him up on that recommendation. We tried the Sangria Flight and they were really good! The Beehive Sangria was the best in my opinion! The other appetizers were all delicious, and we really appreciated the generosity! Great way to start up the stomach engines. We contemplated ordering two pizzas but ended up ordering a full salad and one thin crust pizza. The Sicilian was delicious! We were full before we knew it! The food came out really fast! We felt well taken care of! By then we were being served by someone else since Javier had to leave. The waitress asked if we were interested in dessert and that's when my girlfriend remembered about her free birthday reward (that is, a free dessert excluding any ice cream). She brought out our Key Lime Pie (and deducted the cost from our check) and gave us some forks. The pie was amazing! It was nice and zesty. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit. Thank you CPK.

I have been meaning to write a review on this place for years, as I have been a customer that long. I live and work in downtown LA. There are very few places in downtown to go to when you don't have food in the house, don't want to cook, don't have time to go to the gorcery store, and don't want to spend a fortune. (Most of the restaurants downtown are expensive). CPK on Hope Street fits the bill. This place is within walking distance of where I live and work. Not only is it convenient, but it is really my version of "Cheers." I often see my neighbors in this restaurant. Sometimes I join them when I see them. The waitresses know many of us, and we are all on a first name basis.  "Everybody knows our names."   Sometimes when I go in by myself, the waitresses will ask me where my other neighbors are, or if I have seen them. Sometimes when the waitresses have checked out, they will sit down at my table and join me for a conversation while I am eating.  One of the waitresses has been to my home for dinner. Others will be invited. So, not only does this place feel like home, but also the food is tasty, heathly and affordable. (They have salads and vegetarian dishes, as well as pasta and pizza's). Unfortuately, CPK on Hope Street will be closing down. Next Friday night, February 17, 2017, is their last night. I am really going to miss this place. I am going to miss seeing my neighbors there, and the people who work there. I am going to miss my version of "Cheers." Even though this location will be closing its doors, I just had to write a review of them before they are gone. Thanks to everyone who works there who have made many of us feel at home. You will all  be missed! I hope that most of us will keep in touch!

We just found out that this location is closing today. This is my family and friends favorite CPK location, over 20 years. We've driven two hours just to make it to this location even though there were others along the way. Out of all the CPK locations we've visited in California and other states, this is the best location when it comes to ambiance, food, and service. Our experience has always been great with the different managers and servers. Especially because this location has Javier.  Javier doesn't just take orders and brings food. He treats everyone as if they were family coming over to share a meal at his home. He's patient with large groups and children. Always suggesting appetizers and plates based on ingredients that you may or may not like. He'll say, "next time you're here try the...".  One time a group of women was sitting across from us and one of them ordered a bottle of her favorite wine. Her friends were surprised that Javier would remember to which the lady spoke highly of him. That's the level of service you'd only expect at a Morton's or Mastro's.  We're going to miss this location. Wish everyone and Javier the best.

This CPK location has deteriorated over the past year. It used to be where my office orders catering luncheon but they have always made mistakes in order and deliver food late. Our order today was messed up again. None of our side orders came and order was 45 mins late.

The Service: So So.... our server hardly checked on us. We had to ask for refill or any kind of service.  The Food:  California Club Pizza - Nueske's applewood smoked bacon, roasted chicken and mozzarella, hearth-baked then topped with avocado, wild arugula, fresh torn basil and romaine tossed in lemon-pepper mayo. Very light pizza, not the heavy sauce type. Nice crust, not too thick. Love the fresh avocado and salad on top. Healthy choice.  The Parking: Parking structure in the building. They validate parking.
The carne asada pizza was really good everything else was bad including the fly in his Dr Pepper.

Recently went here on a Sunday evening to meet family from out of town for dinner.  I used to work about three blocks from this CPK so I have been here a few times.  I called ahead to make a reservation.  The young lady that took my call curtly told me that they did not take reservations.  OK.  I then inquired about the parking.  In the past, I always walked to this restaurant and did not know about the parking.  Again, she was abrupt with her explanation about the parking.  I was beginning to have second thoughts about coming here. We met our party in front of the restaurant.  We were greeted immediately on going into the restaurant.  We were seated right away, given menus and our drink order taken.  Our drinks came right away and they brought us complimentary bread.   Our party ordered mainly salads.  I had the Jambalaya Fettuccine (Blackened chicken and shrimp, crawfish, Andouille sausage and Tasso ham in spicy Cajun sauce. My meal was pretty good.  Not too spicy but the sauce was a bit heavy.  My complaint would be my shrimp still had their tails on.  I DO NOT EAT SHRIMP TAILS AND I DO NOT WANT TAIL-ON SHRIMP IN A DISH.  It is a pain trying to get the tails off shrimp when it is buried in fettuccine.  When shrimp is served by itself, no problem if you leave the tails on.  Ok, rant over. Everyone seemed to enjoy their meals.  Our server stopped by from time to time to check on us and refill drinks.  Good service.  Happily, our server did not try to rush us out the door.  We had a nice, leisurely dinner. The noise level in this restaurant is usually pretty bad.  However, carrying on a conversation was fairly easy this evening.  When we got up to leave, I realized why.  There was hardly anyone in the restaurant when we left.

Am so sad this CPK is now closed! Have eaten here so many times since I work in the building, and it's been old reliable for me, lunches and take home dinners for late nights. You will be missed! Wondering what they are planning to do with the space- both the McDonalds and Taipan have closed in the past few years, but some how the Smoke BBQ place stays open?

+ Great service + Timely served food + Clean + Has a bar! Lunch was on the boss this day, so we decided to come out to CPK to fill our tummy in. Have always walked past this CPK but never ate here, until now. We had a party of 5 and everything was pretty solid. Our order, drinks, food, etc.. everything was taken care of and handled in a timely manner. We couldn't have asked for more really. I forgot whom the waitress was, but she was really friendly and made our experience here solid. Also, I'd like to note on how clean the place was, and very lively as well. Very nice environment, one of the better CPK's I've been to. Next time I come here, I've made it a note to take advantage of the bar area, as there was no one sitting there. Overall, great place from start to finish. Do come here if you're looking for a cool sit down for lunch without the high-ish LA prices. Just don't expect out of this world food.

CPK went above and beyond my party on the day of this visit!  As most of you know (those who know me personally) I work for LAUSD, and this was the day of the Teachers Union rally. There were thousands of (for lack of a better word) "Red Shirts" along with friends and family. And the few times I walked by before and after the rally there were nothing but Red Shirts inside.  After the Rally, there at least 50 people in my group and all of us were served and helped out with out any problem. Also, many thanks for them helping out the Union and PTA as a small portion of the proceeds went to help out or school.  Kudos to you CPK! Also, they provided parking validation.

THANK YOU, THANK YOU CPK for catering our Holiday Office Party this year!!!! The manager and the whole team really came together this morning to get a huge order out in a timely fashion!!! I can't thank you guys enough for 1. preparing the food on time (everything was ready when  I got there), 2. for hand carrying all the bags out to the car (talk about curb side service), 3. running all those gift cards through and 4. doing all of this with a smile! You guys are fantastic! The food was a hit! We will definitely be back next year!
Came here for a casual business lunch with a few clients. Great place for sharing some pizza, pasta, and salad.
Bad parking. Terrible service. I like the menu and I often eat at Cpk other locations.

I would say this is a pretty legitimate restaurant.  I've eaten here countless times as I work very close and it's usually consistent.  Their spaghetti Bolognese is surprisingly good for being a chain restaurant.  It is better than pasta dishes I've eaten at some quaint Italian restaurants.  They are always busy and the staff is in control.

I just had the best service at CPK ever!  My husband and I just love dining at CPK, they offer delicious food and a wide variety. Tonight was absolutely Devine. It started with the hostess who immediately seated us and reviewed some new items on the menu. Our server Dave, came over quickly after. He was full of energy, took our drink orders and served it within minutes. When we mentioned it was our first visit he made note of that, took our order and confirmed what we ordered along with our special requests. Very shortly after, the manager, Gloria, came over to introduce herself and welcomed us. In less than 2 minutes Dave walked by and served us with a complimentary Spinach and Mushroom Flatbread. We had their BBQ Chopped Chicken Salad and from the many times we have ordered this in the past, it never tasted this good! The ingredients tasted so fresh and the lettuce was cold and crisp. We then received the Tequila Chicken and Lime Fettuccine and the noodles were al dente, the sauce was savory and flavorful without being too heavy. My compliments to the chef! Overall, I am ecstatically jumping for joy inside as I just moved down the street and will now be making this a regular stop for dinner. If the service and food stays consistent, I will be referring everyone here!

My coworker and I came here because we just got paid (yeeeeeah) and we wanted to be fancy ladies.  The service was great. Our server Javier was a sweetheart and he knew his stuff.  His recommendations were on point.  The food was bomb too. Homegirl had tequila shrimp pasta and I got Kung pao shrimp spaghetti--ssssoooooooo good.  I was like why don't I eat more pasta?!?!  I'm not the biggest fan of spaghetti but it was aaahhhhh-mazing.  My dish was spicy and sweet, but I wish it had more shrimp.  The Appleberry sangria was tasty also, I'd recommend it.   Overall great experience. However if you're coming for lunch after 11:30 on a weekday it can be crowded!

I haven't been to CPK in a very long time and was really looking forward to some nostalgia this evening. Mind you it was near closing time...which is why I called ahead to make sure the restaurant was still open and that I am walking to them (I live across the street). I was told yes, they are still open. ...well, I was met with "Sorry, we are closed!" 1 minute later when I arrived at the restaurant....before closing time. I was NOT very happy at the inconsiderate lie I was told! Probably won't come back here.
Steve is the greatest manager! He is very nice and made sure that everything was amazing. Definitely recommend this place.

First time customer here, I did take out and Marilyn was very helpful in helping choose what to get for my first time experience. The avocado club egg rolls are the best, will definitely be going back for more. Friendly welcome and great service.

CPK has better than average salads, and this CPK has very good service.  It is open 7 days a week, which is a real benefit in this area of downtown, because you can grab lunch before seeing a show at the Music Center and avoid Patina's disappointing food and outrageous prices.  It is in the Center Court of the Wells Fargo Building, and there are oodles of tables - inside and out. We came in yesterday for lunch.  M and I split the Morrocan Chicken Salad, which is chopped romaine tossed with dates, cranberries, avocado, almonds, chicken, beets and butternut squash in a champagne vinaigrette.  Perfect to split, this huge salad was not overly dressed and was packed with flavor from all of the unique ingredients and seasonings.  DH had the carnitas pizza, which was delicious.  The crust was fresh and crispy, the cheese was gooey and the meat was tender.  What more can you ask for? Sure, CPK is not necessarily a dining destination, but this is a great place for Sunday lunch before the show.

Have to say I'm not impressed with the new menu. They got rid of my favorite salad, pizza appears to be an afterthought now, and it feels like they're trying too hard to be hip and trendy. And this particular location has terrible acoustics. It was so loud at lunch today that my dining companion and I kept shouting "WHAT?" and leaning closer to hear.
Wonderful staff and manager. Our server Kat was wonderful. Complimentary flat bread from the manager because it was our first visit. Will come back next time we visit LA.

I heart CPK.  I could eat CPK once a week.  I took yelper Marilou C here for her birthday lunch. The place wasn't as crowded as CPK @ 7th & Fig and we were seated right away.   Ordered Caramelized Peach Salad, Four Seasons Pizza & Mango Lemonade. Caramelized Peach Salad:  Marilou C liked this salad a lot.  We actually came back the week after because she wanted the same salad.  I liked it at first but got tired of it after a while.  Not sure if the peach was fresh, maybe it's from the can.  I did like how they added blue cheese to the salad. Four Seasons Pizza: Thin crust pizza with tomatoes, artichoke hearts, salami, mushrooms, onions, Mozzarella and fresh Mozzarella topped with herbs and parmesan.  It was kinda good. Mango Lemonade:  I tend to order this drink or Peach lemonade when I go to CPK.  Free refill as always. 3.5 stars!! CPK is yummylicious!!
Place is in a nice center in the wellsfargo building! My server was so nice and we really loves the avocado chicken bacon rolls! So good! Pizza was okay too. Nice ambiance.

I've been to a lot of CPK's, but this is my favorite for two reasons...I love the staff - everyone is so friendly and genuinely interested in you and secondly, they have an outdoor area. This is nice cuz when I'm out cycling, I just park my bike next to me. If you like spicy, get the Carnitas Pizza with Habanera Sauce...if they do it right it will blow your mind.

I had my first to-go order few days back, and left with a filled to-go dinner box.  I was really hungry, so I almost finished the plate size at the same night.  Honestly, the food quality wasn't really go with the $12 price, and my Spaghetti Bolognese order tasted like regular meaty dish.  The server forgot to give me the complimentary pre-dinner bread I had requested over the phone.  I rushed to leave the restaurant in 5 mins as the parking restriction limit.  I believe I might have a better experience if I dine in! :)

I don't usually rate chain places because they're pretty consistent for the most part. This place is like most CPK's with the exception that they're extremely stingy with the meat. As long as you don't add chicken or shrimp to your pasta you should be good to go. I ordered a pesto pasta with chicken added and as soon as I opened it up, I initially thought they forgot to add it. Then I noticed the  4 tiny pieces of chicken that cost $3 to add to the pasta. Wow, really? I want my $3 back Mr. Manager. On the plus side, very fast service.

CPK is one of our family's favorite places to eat , we've been to California Pizza Kitchen in Torrance, Redondo Beach and now downtown Los Angeles we were in Los Angeles on Friday visiting the Broad Museum and within walking distance from the museum a CPK our pizza was delicious and our salad was tasty but it was the customer service that sets this CPK apart from the others from the minute we walked in we were greeted with smiles and welcomed , thank you Dave for your hospitality and customer service, the avocado dip and chips were a pleasant surprise thumbs up.

We went on a Friday afternoon. The place was moderately crowded so we were seated almost immediately. I had the California veggie pizza for the main course and a shitake mushroom flatbread for starters. Loved the pizza!. I normally don't eat the crust but the pizza crust in here was so flaky and crusty. The pizza was not loaded with cheese, i could say it just had the right amount of cheese.  The service was also good. Overall i had a good experience and i would definitely go there again!

if you're gonna take-out, call ahead so you don't wait forever for them to put together your order.  Always check your order before leaving because years of experience has shown me that they will inevitably screw up large orders.  you don't want your boss to be missing an order and you have to walk allllll the way back to CPK to pick it up. with large parties, get everyone's order and fax it in so that once you sit down, your food will come promptly.  this is how you get birthday lunches done within an hour.  i'd make a good admin but I would never want to be at the bottom of the food chain like that. Today my boss was ordering lunch, so I told her that I'll eat what she eats.  So I ended up with an order of Singapore Shrimp rolls and a half-sized original bbq chicken salad. Shrimp, baby broccoli, soy-glazed Shiitake mushrooms, spinach, carrots, rice noodles, bean sprouts, green onion and cilantro wrapped in rice paper. Served chilled with a sesame-ginger dipping sauce and a side of Szechuan slaw (Does Szechuan really mean a dish of chopped raw cabbage? If i were in China i wouldn't dare to eat any produce raw.) the original bbq chicken salad is pretty tasty: Chopped lettuce, black beans, sweet corn, jicama, cilantro, basil, crispy corn tortilla strips and Monterey Jack cheese tossed together in herb ranch dressing. Topped with chopped BBQ chicken breast, diced tomatoes and green onions. CPK gets the job done, but i would never eat at this chain with my own money. see pics.
$7.95 for parking during lunch. I guess in downtown that is reasonable? I'd  use that money and go elsewhere.
The quality of their pizza is so exquisite that it satisfies your hunger any time of the day. Great guest service and clean environment.

Went during lunch for a lunch meeting on a weekday and though we finished our meals and discussing business, we were told that there was a party of 5 waiting and we had to leave since we were done eating. We were only seated for about an hour total. Further, the bathroom shares the same door as the area where the servers bring dirty plates to the kitchen. One particular server kicks the door open without warning, not knowing that somebody may be on the other side of the door. I've been here several times and I understand it gets busy but safety and courtesy shouldn't be forgotten in the process. Plus, CPK is a sit-down restaurant in the middle of downtown LA. Wouldn't you expect patrons to sit for awhile after eating to discuss business? I'm disappointed and wish Nick and Stef's would hurry up and open again.

Service here is usually good.  I've never had to wait too long as long as you get there earlier enough before  a show at the Taper or Ahmanson.  Free parking is available underneath and you don't have to valet park the car in spite of what the signs might lead you to believe.   The food is the same as every other CPK and even CPK Express and fairly consistent.
Its a awesome place positive vibe. Everytime i go work is like going to a second home we are a family and love to work with each other.

I went in on 5/19 for dinner. My server was Abby. Let me tell you she was terrific. She had a great smile and personality. She answered all my questions with a smile. This was my first visit to CPK, it was the best experience I could have asked for. I will definitely be back and ask for Abby.

I met my wife for lunch here one afternoon. I was worried because my wife only gets one hour for lunch and the place was packed. However, we were seated right away. Our drinks and bread came out soon after that. We share an order of spinach artichoke dip and a margherita pizza. The food was brought out quickly. Fast and friendly service.  The only reason this was a 4 star and not a 5 is because the dip was more runny that what I am used to from other CPK's and the crust on the pizza was a bit more chewy than other thin crust pizzas that I've had at other CPK's. I understand it could have been an off day, so I income back and it's better, I'm more than happy to edit this to 5 stars.

Hidden but great!!! The service was awesome  the food was delicious I love the atmosphere because u can actually be kind of loud and no one cares overall it's the best California pizza kitchen I been to really great !! A lot of business peopel go lol

It's CPK.  It is was it is.  They are really busy at lunch, and the service is slow.  The food, however, is pretty consistent across any CPK.  I shared a pizza and salad with a friend.  We spent about $15.  Not too bad, but still a bit overpriced for what it is.

I cam here the other night before going to a play, and I loved the service. The staff were friendly, which plays a big role in my return to this CPK restaurant. The servers were knowledgable about the items,and the manager ( a short lady with black hair) was great. She made a great impression, since she came over to our table and asked us how we were doing. She was able to make a GENUINE conversation, which many managers do not have. I recommend people to come eat here before they go to any plays or museums in downtown LA. I strongly recommend that people eat at least two hours before their scheduled event.

Wonderful service. I had placed an online order the night before a production shoot and when I showed up it wasn't in their system.  The dining room looked pretty busy so I panicked a little bit, but the manager and take-out girl assured me they could have my order ready in 15 mins while I waited.  The manger gave me a bottle of water while I waited, and somehow they put my order together before I finished my water.  I even received a small discount for the trouble.  I was impressed with their concern for my situation and their overall attitudes.  Very good customer service!  I have used them twice since, all for big production accommodations. They have been good to me 3 out of 3 times :)

The food options are pretty diverse for a place with Pizza in its title. Options range from Quinoa Salads, Chile Rellenos to Pizza of course. Much of the food has very different and unique takes on food that make it far from traditional....not that, that is wrong. Only complaint.....the sound is terrible and the service is average.

Overpriced pizza that tastes worse than pizza hut. Walked in here because the restaurant across the street wasn't serving food at that time. I ordered a BBQ chicken pizza and I can literally count the chicken on there. The sauce and cheese was so scarce. 14$ is totally not worth it. Friend got the Thai pasta or something similar, it did not taste so great very salty. The pasta felt very hard, I don't know CPK..I don't think I'll ever try another CPK after this. Servers were nice, but there were only 2 other customers..

Take out: I have to order from here a lot since I work late. This place has some great food. Ordering online is really easy and they'll have it ready for you to pick up in 20 minutes maybe 30 if you're ordering more than 5 main courses.  LOOK OUT: When picking up, don't forget the drinks. They always forget the drinks. (3/5 times)

When a restaurant brings out sarcastic thoughts from the customer, you know something is deeply wrong with the place. CPK does not serve food - it rations it. I sent back my Moroccan Chicken Salad because there was virtually no chicken in it. I asked the waitress for the menu so that I could order something else. The manager comes over to have a "discussion" with me instead. He asked if there was a problem. I explained that I could not find any chicken on the plate and he responds that their policy is 2.5 ounces per plate. I feel like I should have asked him for a magnifying glass instead. Clearly the food portions here are based on scarcity such as one would have found in post-war restaurants in Europe. BTW this restaurant was virtually empty when we arrived at about 5pm and when we asked for a better seat near the big window, we were given a lame explanation why we couldn't sit there. The margueritas are overpriced. Get the picture? This is about the third time in a row that I have had a negative experience at CPK. I will not return.

I've been to this California Pizza Kitchen a few times before and it had good food, friendly service and fair prices.  News:   ALL is gone.    We ate here before a concert and we were greeted by a manager- type employee who did not have friendly people skills.    The wine and beer is now expensive or at the very least just not a good buy anymore.   First we had the "Smashed Pea" soup.  This used to be a favorite to us - a delicious soup, steaming hot, and it filled the bowl generously.  Now, the bowl was filled 1/2 inch down from the rim and only slightly warm.  In addition, this soup tasted stale.  The spring rolls I had ordered had very little chicken and lots of dough.  Again, the taste was not great.  The BLT rolls had been fried in oil and arrived covered with oil.  They were luke-warm, soggy and very oily and heavy.  Service was poor - orders were taken after a wait, dishes were not picked up. They put bottled water on the table to entice customer to purchase bottled water. Table tops are dirty and sticky. Here's the bottom line:  There was nothing in this visit that was pleasant.  The service was not good or friendly, the food was cold, soggy and oily, the wine was not a good buy, the portions on everything were smaller and food pricing is high.  We will not be back to this or any other California Pizza Kitchen.
They were awesome! Service was spot on and the food was incredible.  Kat was an amazing servicer. I would highly recommend this restaurant.

Been here three times in the past two weeks.  The food is always good and the desserts are great.  The service here is awful.  I have to ask the server at least twice and one time three times for hot sauce.  One of my co-workers had to ask twice for lemon in her water.  Today we sat nearly 10 minutes before anyone came to wait on us.  It would be a good excuse if it were busy.  However, we went right at 1130 when they opened and staff was having too much fun to cater to the customers.  I'm through with this place for awhile.
Too bad.  There's no 0 rating.. Waited for over an hour for my order and still not served! Waiter told that somebody took my order.  Awful!!

I live right across from this location in Grand Towers in DTLA. It saddens me that they have a patio that is completely empty and they choose not to serve me because I have lil Diesel (my Cairn Terrier) with me.  Forget the times I've been there before and this wasn't a problem.  Forget the hundreds of dollars that I've spent at this location already.  Forget that there was very little patronage at this location and and perhaps there are reasons like poor customer relations.  I will not forget John Toffik's delivery of dismissive information and his snarky smile at me and my party.  The condescending tone hurt, but I wish you well in your career in restaurant management.

I came here last night with my sister and her boyfriend, STARVED and ready to enjoy dinner at a restaurant chain we usually enjoy very much: CPK. First of all, there is no sign outside of the Wells Fargo center so if it's your first time here, you will probably have a really difficult time finding it. We tried calling the restaurant multiple times to ask for directions but no one would pick up. After driving up and down Hope St. we finally just parked (it was about $4 an hour for street parking) and decided to walk into the Wells Fargo center to ask for directions. Lo and behold, it was up the stairs inside the building. We felt pretty stupid lol. So we walk in, and there is no host or anyone at the front to seat us. We stood there for a few minutes and a really friendly employee ran towards us and apologized for the wait and sat us at a table near the window. He told us a server would be with us in a minute. Fifteen minutes later, no server. So we flagged the guy who sat us down and got our drinks from him. Another ten minutes later, I got really frustrated and asked the manager if we could order. He was extremely friendly and started helping us, and at this time the waitress comes over and starts asking us if we'd like to order...in the middle of us talking and ordering from someone else. Wtf? We ordered our favorites: I got the Chicken Tequila Fettucine & Wedge Salad, my sister got the Kung Pao Spaghetti, and her boyfriend got the Chipotle Chicken Pizza. We also got the Avocado Club Eggrolls for an appetizer. The Kung Pao Spaghetti was a disgusting congealed mess and it looked like bloated worms on a plate. I tried a little bit and gagged, and my sister took a huge bite and spit it back out. It tasted....really bad. The sauce was not right and the noodles were very overcooked. We sent it back but thankfully everything else that came out was perfect and tasted great. Throughout the entire meal, our waitress forgot things we asked her to get for us such as extra napkins, drink refills, hot sauce, lime, and etc. We had to keep getting them from the manager. The entire time we were there, we were really friendly but for some reason the waitress kept avoiding us like the plague and forgetting our things. We even took turns getting up a few times to grab things such as napkins or plates because we were short on them. Even the waitress that was working another section of the restaurant in the way back came over and asked us if we needed anything. Our own waitress couldn't do that? At the end of our meal, the manager could tell we were not happy with our waitress (even though we didn't complain about her, he is either psychic or has a good eye) so he gave us 3 snickerdoodle cookies on the house which was really nice of him! If they just got rid of that one waitress, I'd have no problem coming back to this location.

It's CPK, what can you expect?  When you've been to one, you've been to all of them. Their pizzas and pastas are good--no way to fudge that up.  Most of their food is decent but salads that have 1,000 calories?  Egh.  Salad isn't even a real food... Anyway, service at this location is good, but I get take-out to avoid all their upselling when you're just trying to order a pizza.

Messed up our order and took their sweet time. However, they did not charge for the pizza which was good. Bang bang shrimp was expensive and too small of a portion. The pizza itself was below-average for the standard I expected from CPK.  Food: 1/5 Price: Doesn't really apply Ambiance: 3/5 Service: 1/5

Picked up my chick for lunch. Came over here. Place was packed. Couldn't find a seat, sat up at the bar? Had the lettuce & shrimp wraps, big fan of 'em, ever since she got me hooked. Waitress was nice and talkative. Strawberry margarita was weak. My chick's pina coloda twist was way better, drank most of hers.  :) Finally got to try the BBQ Chicken Pizza, went to the West Covina location but never tried the Pizza. Had two slices, wanted to eat the whole thing but couldn't, she had to go back to work.  I was sad.  :(    It didn't taste the same when I threw it in the microwave.  :( Want to go back for more BBQ Chicken Pizza.  :)

First time here even tho I worked in the area for years. I was in the mood for chicken fettuccine. Staff was nice and I waited for my food. Place was busy as hell so I understood if the food was taking awhile. I was surprised when the waiter came to apologize for the delay. No biggie. Then the manager came out and said my meal was comped. Sweet. The food was great ! But I'm super biased on free food ;p waiter wouldn't even charge me my ice tea even though I asked him to. I had no cash for tip so I wanted to leave some on my card but he refused. Double sweet!

You can never go wrong with the spinach artichoke dip and a nice bowl of soup. The service was good and our food came quickly.  I have to agree with other yelpers that it was a little tricky to find, but the complimentary valet parking was nice. We also went at a time of the day when it wasn't really busy, so that was kinda nice.

Convenient, because it is close to the Music Center and Disney Concert hall.  We see shows on a regular basis, so it offers us another dinner option.  The customer service could be improved.  It is often slow (even when they are not full) and the servers seem to be new or in training.  The food is pretty consistent with other CPKs, with the exception of the pasta.  We like "al dente," but the pasta has actually been served to us undercooked.  Not the best CPK.

The food here is exceptional. ..especially if you are looking for something light!! I had the asparagus and arugula salad with a side of chimicurri sauce:) My fiance had the pepperoni pizza which was fresh out of the pizza oven. The thin crust made it extra tasty! While we waited for our meal we indulged in oregano seasoned olive oil and mini baguette slices. I would give this place 10 stars if I could. The manager John was very hospitable and checked in with all his guests at their tables...pretty rare! Our waitresses (Abby and Kitty) were on top of their game. I look forward to coming here again in the future!

Eh, I ordered linguini with baby clams in red sauce and the convo with the waiter went like this..  me: i'll get the linguini with baby clams Waiter: white or red sauce? Me: red Waiter: white? Me: no, red sauce Waiter: oh ok white Me: RED sauce!! Waiter: ohh ok After 5 minutes or so, he brings me my lunch, linguini in white sauce.. It wasn't bad but geesh.. Minus one star for the craptacular waiter

What started out as a disappointing dining experience (due to an overcooked salmon) turned out to surpass my expectations by the high level of professionalism I was dealt with by the restaurant Manager, Tavic (Sp?). I worked as a restaurant manager myself for four years and it's rare to come across someone who genuinely cares about your experience and doesn't just drop the ball after listening to a complaint. I was maybe expecting my main course to be comped when I returned , but I was blown away when he took care of my whole bill! I will definitely be returning to this restaurant and give it a very high recommendation to my friends! Thank You!

I'm not sure if it was an off day for the employees there, but I waited about 45 minutes for my pizza. And to make things worse, the pizza was about 1mm thick and the crust was burnt. I've been to better CPKs...
Love the seating area outside as inside it feels kind of stuffy and loud.

What happened to the quality here? When they first opened this place was the "it" place to be.  Their menu is so morphed now, they sell tacos? What? And the quality of food has gone down significantly.  Yuck.  It all tastes pre packaged.  The only things that still tastes decent are their salads.  I will not be going back here again any time soon.

We went to CPK on Saturday for takeout.  It was just too hot to be out and about. I usually go to the one at 7th and Figueroa, but this location is just as close to my apartment.  I dropped my boyfriend off at 3rd and Hope, because the street was blocked off.  I drove around and looked for a parking spot.   It took him a while to find the location.  I guess it's not really visible from Hope, and he said he had to climb some stairs.  He remarked that this CPK had a B-rating, but the food was fine.  He had the chicken club pizza on wheat, and I had the jambalaya pasta.  The portion was good, they didn't skimp on the protein, and I had no complaints. If you are looking to do takeout, this CPK is more easily accessed and is visible from Grand. Enjoy!

I love CPK no matter which location it is but let me just tell you about how amazing the service was at this location!  Special shout out to our AMAZING server MANUEL!  We got there towards the closing of the restaurant and towards the end of their shift people tend to not care but Manuel was so friendly and charasmatic! He always smiled and came by every once in a whole to offer more drinks or so. He was super funny and overall I experienced one of the best meals ever!  There needs to be more ppl like you MANUEL!  Ps: "you rock my socks"(:
I used to work right across from this location in DTLA. It hits us that they have a hallway that is not very wide.  I hope they improve their costumer relation.

DIFFERENT CITY BUT SAME GREAT FOOD! I barely found this place in the heart of downtown LA.  It's kind of hidden under a building and not really all that busy which was a plus right at dinner time.  (But then again, I figured it wasn't busy cause it is tucked away).   I ordered the classic Waldorf Chicken Salad and it was very delicious as it usually is.   I think honestly, its one of those CPK's that is probably SUPER busy during lunch but if you find yourself in the part of Downtown LA at dinner time and want a good meal, without the wait, this option is here for you!
Good place.  If you like CPK and you are around the area, can't go wrong!

I'm personally not a big fan of chain restaurants, but my coworkers wanted to have lunch here a few weeks ago when I was in LA.  There is nothing wrong with it, I just prefer trying local restaurants instead.  However, our pizzas were very good!

Today our department supervisor order lunch for us today for pick up. Rest of my department enjoyed their lunch(they ordered various pasta dishes. I ordered the new Korean BBQ style pizza. Was not good at all. Maybe could have been better if the slaw that appeared pictured on the website on pizza was on my pizza.

Came by before a show at the Ahmanson and obviously time was a factor.  You would think that a CPK located in the Wells Fargo Center and by the Music Center would be more considerate of guests in a hurry.  However, this was not the case as we walked in.  The host was not present at his station and took a few minutes to come and get us seated in a relatively uncrowded restaurant.  The server took our drink orders and did not come back with them promptly, and on top of that, we had to wait even longer for her to take our orders since the busser came by with the drinks.  The actual food was prepared well and comparatively better than most CPK locations-just don't come by in a hurry (we missed the opening scene of South Pacific).

The last few times I've been to this location, the service has been incredibly friendly, seating was immediate, and the food came out right away. I've just got to take away one star-- the last 2 times I went with large groups and one person each time received the wrong order.  Since this location is surrounded by high rises, I definitely recommend this location for evening dining or evening parties because it is empty! Plus there's 2 hrs validated parking in the underground lot for $7. After 4PM, 3 Hours Free! It is valet, so tips are appreciated since it's free.

This is by far the Best CPK I have ever come to. Maybe it is purely the Alcohol talking (cuz I came here for dinner right after Casa across the street) but I ate every bite of food put in front of me. My girl and I shared a Mediterranean plate to start and then I had the chicken Milanese. MMMM sooo good. I have gone to many CPK's in the past but I will say it again this is by far the best I have ever had!

the noise level is atrocious at this location and you can hardly hear your own voice, let alone that of the person who you dine with. Ordered the shrimp scampi with the fettucini noodles. An expensive $14.00 dish and there was hardly anything on the plate-not enough noodles and if the idea was to keep a low caloric dish, then more vegetables should have been on the plate and not only zucchini. Broccholi, green beans and thinly sliced carrots with mushrooms would have been nice. In addition, the flavor is nothing to write home about-mostly garlic and pretty tasteless. This is a new dish on the menu and badly needs improvement. Management, please listen!

I love CPK but this one holds a special place with me=) It is my go-to no fail restaurant in downtown. The wait is never too long even though it always seems ultra crowded. It's a tight dining experience with the tables practically inches away from each other. Service is fast.  My fav dishes are the pastas and sandwiches, salads are good too. Ironically the pizza is just okay. I haven't had one fail me yet. The portion sizes are big so I usually split with a friend.

I do not like restaurant chains, I simply don't... give me a little hole in the wall or a "proper" restaurant, but please.. no chains.  However, living in the US makes it sheer impossible to avoid those, so every now and then I find myself in one.  This one is located in downtown LA and I was having a simple meal with my friend Robbie. We decided to share a pizza and a waldorf salad.  The pizza was nothing worth writing home about, but the Waldorf Salad was definitely very nice. So, I ordered it again after I shopped at IKEA in Burbank... and oh, such disappointment.  Result: I am following my principe again and stay away from chains.

LOVE the pizza here... always, always on a thin, crunchy crust.The spagetti is PHENOMINAL. Service IS FANTASTICand you can get a seat fairly quickly. All good :) I usually come to CPK every couple of months. Its a decent place to get pizza, especially if you're in the mood to get something a little different from your traditional pepperoni pizza. I got the roasted garlic chicken pizza with the whole grain dough. The crust was really well done. MY friend ordered the Tostada pizza ..she  just could not get enough of this.  she said  this pizzahas so much flavor in one pizza.  It has lettuce on top so Ishe thought it was good for hertill sheread the nutrition info and saw it was one of the highest in calories.  so she wont be having that anymore. he he he...... no matter what i just love CPK.....

Once again CPK nailed it.  I went with their original BBQ salad-and  was not disappointed. Indoors can get loud at this CPK (Wells Fargo Center)  I'm not too sure why this restaurant in particular but this one seems to get loud inside.  This visit we sat outside in the sun and all was good.

Worst food in a while.  I won't be going back. To prob include the other locations.  The B team was on.  My waitress was fine although it feels like management is trying to make up for poor environment by pushing the employees

First time in my life I ever sent a meal back. The Cobb salad was disgusting...It came out within 2 minutes of ordering...the bacon was cold and looked and tasted old.  The entire kitchen staff was sitting and eating in the restaurant on their break which made me think the bartender threw together a quick salad.   I sent it back and he brought me pasta instead and said "here you go baby" while he smacked on his gum. He was in a rush to close out my bill so he asked me "are you going to chill here for a minute or what"   Bad service.
Very friendly staff. Especially Jeff the bartender. Always very welcoming and accommodating.

Javier is the waiter you want to be taking care of you, super nice and very professional. A lot of waiters aren't like him at all at this location, for example, Yadira was one of the waitresses that gave attitude and when we sat down she looked at us and didn't even hand us a menu. But Javier great, his service was genuine, and it was very appreciated.

I've visited this CPK a few times, once with a very large group, and the service was really on top of getting all the orders spot-on right. If you are familiar with CPK's menu, all the favorites are here. Lunch is even more appealing, since their lunch specials offer smaller, 7-inch pizzas, which you can get with soup or salad. It's a really fantastic sit-down option for an area that tends to be overpriced. I really enjoyed my experience, and recommend that if you have a craving for CPK, you visit this one instead of the one at 7th & Fig. This one is far superior.

*** Pit stop review (Downtown LA)*** I had a meeting and ended up hanging out in Downtown LA. After waking up at 3 am to start my trek at 5 am I was happy to have lunch at a decent place. My previous experience at California Pizza kitchen was really nothing to rave about. However, this location is something really different.  I just had the lunch special, pizza and soup. The pizza and soup lunch special was so-so. The service was AMAZING! The waitress took our order. She always came back to check up on us. She had a very nice positive and bubbly personality. She made the dining experience better with some great service.  This is a nice place to have a lunch break if you have to conduct business in downtown LA.  If you park in the Wellsfargo building parking structure remember to bring in the parking ticket to get a discount. There's no validation available. If you're in the building all day the parking fee is $45.  Also, plan to leave your full sized vehicle at home or park elsewhere. Only passenger vehicles can fit into the underground parking structure.  Food = average Seating area = Very clean Service = Super  Restroom = Very clean

Ordered the egg and potatoe pizza. (Ask for crispy ). The mule is really good, love the fresh ginger. Thanks kitty! Javier (server) was the man. Super nice and helpful. The manager (Ms. Good from Pittsburgh) came by and check on us and made us feel very welcomed. Also, knew we were newbies in the resturant. This was a first time in CPK. And it was great. Thanks guys!!
Just dined there with my coworker for lunch. Thanks Javier for your great service the place was empty when we arrived and packed when we left. Happy Holidays!

My boyfriend and I were out and about in LA a few days ago checking out MOCA and decided we were in the mood for their hawaiian pizza and caesar salad. We got to the restaurant and waited for 4 minutes or so before someone came up to seat us. Once we finally got seated, it took another 10 minutes or so before our waiter came out to greet us. When she did, she seemed extremely rushed and following the drink order, she went directly up to the bar and started talking with her friends who were sitting at the bar rather than inputting our drinks. Our food was good when it came out, but right after its arrival, my boyfriend looked back and the half the staff was sitting at the back of the restaurant talking and on their phones eating lunch. Our waitress went back there at one point too. Not a great experience here at CPK.

Ok, here's the deal.  It's a chain. The food is decent, but because it's Downtown, it's completely overpriced for what you get.  Or maybe their prices are consistent whether in the city or the burbs, IDK, but it feels high. Here's why they get 4 stars from me.  Customer Service.  I went here for a coworker's birthday lunch, and while the service was frustratingly slow, at the end of our meal, and kind of out of the blue, at least to me, 2 women from my party complained about their food so much that the manager comped both meals (despite the fact that the ladies had eaten at least 3/4ths of their meals. Then, the birthday girl had a couple of coupons - both of which the manager applied to the bill in addition to comping the 2 meals.  Lunch for 4 with tax came to about $24.  Of course we tipped 20% on the entire amount.  Frankly, I was embarrassed.  One of the ladies complained about the fact that they have recently switched from Pepsi to Coke.  YAY!!! I really dislike Pepsi.  She also complained about the new pizza crust, which I also liked. Anyway, kudos for letting the customer be right.  I'll definitely eat/drink here again for that reason alone. Also their sangria is the bomb. Cheers!

Been here occasionally for takeout over the last few years.  Service seems to have always be on point but as other reviewers mentioned, the food here very sub-par.   The last 3 orders of pizza came with very little sauce (even after asking for extra sauce) & barely any visible cheese, and with any meat order you'll be lucky to get 3-4 tiny pieces unevenly scattered on one side.  I tried complaining once, got a refund.  When it happened again months later, I ate the cost and just decided I won't eat here again. I imagine this is a high rent location so be warned that cost cutting is most likely the primary objective in the kitchen staff's daily meetings. You'd be better off buying a quality frozen pizza.

Must I? I must. CPK has been my late night solution for quick decent meal as of late. While most of my coworkers remain tired of their meals and lack of nearby late-night options, I come here for a decent cup of tortilla soup and sandwich. The sandwich isn't anything special. The bread is typically of a onion or garlic base, with tons of shredded iceberg lettuce that loves to fall out of the sandwich. The sandwich is poorly put together. It needs a wrap to keep it together. I typically opt for the chicken, and let me add there's nothing special with that either. It's rather bland, but clearly a healthy choice, unlike the bread. The tortilla soup is good and chunky, despite the high sodium. I find the soup to be better than neighboring options that Dan's Deli or Mendocino may offer. You just get more for your money here as well.  Parking isn't a great option around here. You can park at meters along Grand or Hope, and it's free after 8:00 p.m. Monday-Saturdays (free Sundays). Consider if if you're on bunker hill, and don't feel like driving to the historic core of downtown for some eats.
They are fine and good about getting you out to theater on time. Why are their holiday decorations still up in late February?

This is in the atrium area near the Wells Fargo Building. The kiosk is manned by a smiling, friendly man. It's good for a quick bite to eat. There are salads, soups, and sandwiches, all prepared and ready to go! I had a nice Waldorf Chicken salad with bread and olive oil. The salad was tasty and made a pleasant fast lunch!

This is now my favorite California Pizza Kitchen. In truth though it's only the second CPK I've ever visited even though this chain has locations everywhere.  I went there for lunch today picking its location out of sheer convenience because it is located near the Millennium Biltmore Hotel where I am staying. The purpose of this selection was two-fold.  First I wanted to do a little carbo-loading for tomorrow's Rock n Roll Half Marathon, and second and most important I was really hungry having eaten nothing for seven hours since my 7 AM dim sum breakfast in Chinatown. Greeted and sat down at a booth next to the bar where I got to see a little college football on the television the service was cordial, friendly and fast.  They have pastas here too, but I really thought I would have room for more food later that night so I selected pizza instead. The Carne Asada Pizza was described quite well so that's what I went for along with a Peach Lemonade.  The peach lemonade was not too peachy and very sweet.  I should have stuck with plain water.  The pizza ( ), however, I loved.  It's grilled steak, fire-roasted peppers, onions, cilantro pesto and two types of cheese.  The crust could have been just a bit crispier, but I appreciated the fresh tomato salsa and tomatillo salsa served to the side.  The grilled steak was cooked medium and was extremely tender. As it turned out all that pizza expanded by all the liquids I consumed simply meant I felt comfortable enough to skip dinner.  I guess I will find out tomorrow if it sufficed.  Thanks CPK!

Yelps 365 Review Challenge 2014 - Los Angeles #97 - #365 You just have to live it up while you're in Downtown Los Angeles! After a job interview in the industrial district, I decide to reward myself with a fancy dinner for all the hard work I put in. I said to myself, "Why Not?" I was deciding between Chinatown and CPK and I picked CPK because of it's amazing views of the Downtown LA sky scrapers.  I felt like I was dining with the executives with their pricey suits, suitcases and admiring their professional demeanor. My waitress was very friendly and attentive to my whole dining experience.  Instead of ordering pizza, I got the Chicken Fettucine Alfredo with the cheapest red wine on the menu! It was the best experience trying to feel like a millionaire on a poor man's budget. Food was excellent and the red wine was sweet. Later I felt a bit tipsy so I drank a lot of water before the long ride home. Other than having lunch at the Getty restaurant, this was a truly memorable experience.

The only bonus to having jury duty for 20 days is having an hour and a half for lunch everyday. You would think that would be enough to walk 3 blocks, get a table at CPK, eat, pay and walk back. Wrong. There is usually a long wait around lunch time here but we were fortunate enough to get seated right away today. It took a while before someone came to get our order. It took even longer for the food to come out. We had been there about 40 minutes before we got our food. The food was okay. We ordered the chipotle chicken pizza and the half Cobb salad. The half salads used to be really big but apparently they have reduced their portion. The salad is much smaller than I remembered and hardly worth it at almost $10. The pizza wasn't very good and there was an average of 2 little chicken cubes per slice. Sadly enough the best part of my meal was the mango iced tea. The server was also nice but there clearly wasn't enough people working for how busy they were. We were late back to court so I don't think I'll be coming again for lunch.

So my coworker and I visited CPK today, haven't been here in awhile and I have to say it was great!  The food is as expected but the service was excellent!  Our waitress was CeeCee (I hoped I spelled it correctly) - she was wonderful and very helpful.  We really appreciated the help she provided in getting us the lunch we wanted (we were a bit complicated). Thanks CeeCee!

I've been to this CPK only to pick up take out orders for the office so I can't say much about the dine-in experience.  We had placed a relatively large order and when we went to pick it up there was no line at the pick up station so that was great. The employees helped us right away but after we paid and everything it took them forever to get our food together. We were standing there for at least 10 minutes waiting for them to put everything together.  The food itself is normal, my favorite pizza is the BBQ chicken, but the works and the veggie are also pretty good. I think the salad was kind of overpriced, but what can you do. Around lunch time this location gets pretty crowded with people who work downtown so beware of the lunch rush!

Never really been a fan of CPK. The only reason I would come here is for their tortilla soup, which is relatively easy to make. I honestly haven't been back in ages, but my cousin's graduation ceremony was right across the street at California Plaza so it was a convenient location for dinner. Let me just say... service really lacks here. It took a long time for our table's drink orders to arrive. I was excited to get their Italian cream sodas, but was later informed that they ran out of cream so they couldn't make it. What?? What a disappointment. It never looks good when a restaurant runs out of ingredients for something on their menu. Especially when it's something as simple as cream! I opted for a Raspberry Cooler instead, which was mediocre. We also clearly asked for sugar for coffee a million times, which also took wayyy longer than it should have. We got so frustrated that we actually got up to get it ourselves! HORRIBLE. Our waiter disappeared plenty of times for long periods. It wasn't even too busy, so there's no excuse for such bad service! I forgot how bad their complimentary bread is, too. It can only be described as stale and cold. It's like eating bread that was left out for too long. Thanks, but no thanks. Service didn't pick up until closing time when everyone was pretty much done with their food. Pretty pointless by then. I won't be returning to CPK for a long, long time if ever again.

CPK is consistently good in my opinion- it's never failed me in the past. This location is especially cool. Maybe it was because our server was super friendly and helpful? Or maybe I was just starving from a really long weekend? Whatever the reason, it tasted delicious! We split the Moroccan Chicken Salad- which was very flavorful and was loaded with vegies and spices. Yummy!! We also split the Eggplant and Chinese Broccoli pizza and honey wheat crust. It was also super delish. My dad ordered a glass of the spicy red wine, and it was tasty too! Yup, even though this is a chain, it's still always a good idea.

A couple weeks ago I ate here while doing jury duty. I had gone to school at USC and remembered the CPK in the Wells Fargo Building was generally less busy and better service so I walked over from the courthouse specifically to visit an old haunt. I was disappointed in my service.  I sat at the counter and the server never made eye contact with me; she looked beyond my head to the hostess stand I assumed.  Second, she brought me a soup I didn't order.... which made me nervous throughout the rest of the meal that she hadn't been listening to my order and would forget something else. When it was time to pay, she dropped the check and left to do something else.  I was particularly annoyed b/c i wanted to hand my money directly to her (i know sometimes cash is stolen by other customers if you don't give it directly to the server.) So I stood there a few minutes, looking directly at her trying to give her my money.  She was too busy, and i feared being held in contempt of court, so I left. I can only assume she got her money and her too generous tip (couldn't get change!)

Best location Ive ever seen for a CPK. Right across from angels flight, awesome patio area. It was so quiet here. The food is always good here, and the staff was very friendly. I had peace, privacy, and a beautiful view.

I love this CPK.  The service is very attentive, fast and pleasant.  I enjoy taking my clients here.  If this hasn't caught your eye, order the butter cake a la mode for dessert at any CPK.  Trust me.

Unfortunately I didn't have a good experience here.  We arrive around 6:15pm for dinner on a Thursday before seeing a 7:30pm show at the Dorthoy Chandler.  We figured CPK is usually a quick tasty meal.  Unfortunately this time it was not.  We were seated immediately, but as we were being seated, I overheard one of the servers saying that her section was totally full.  A few minutes after we sat down, a guy at the table next to us went up to the bar to ask about his food.  It seemed like he had been waiting a while for his food.  We continued to sit at the table for over 10 minutes and no one came by to bring us water, ask for our order, or even tell us that someone would be with us soon.  As I looked around the restaurant, it looked like most people didn't have food on their tables, and some had not even ordered.  Bad sign for us as we were not planning for a drawn out dinner experience.  We finally decided to cut our losses and left. Who knows how long it would have taken us to get our food if it took that long to even order! We may try this place again as they may have had an off night.

On a Thursday afternoon about 6tables with customers...and now I know why. We ordered drinks while we looked at the menu, then we ordered (still no drinks). Looking at the bar the bartender was talking to staff (including manager John), as we continued to wait we realized our waitress used this time to text when she should have been encouraging the bartender to get us our drinks, then the ultimate sign of terrible service...our food arrived before our drinks. Shame on the bartender and waitress as well. Unprofessional would be a complement of this staff. With all the other restaurants downtown we will never come back even though the food was pretty good.
Nice and fresh dont have to worry about anything being nasty.....

I only come here when I need to for work lunches.  CPK like many chains is always predictable.  The food was just fine.  We came during the week at 11:30am and beat the bulk of the corporate lunch crowd.  By 12pm, the place was packed and loud and we had to shout to be heard.  The service was quick and friendly but the waiter was trying just a little too hard with the upsales.

Don't go here for lunch during a workday if you are in a hurry!   This popular "pizza" place is just too busy for good service during weekday lunchtime.  My friends and I got there early to beat the crowd before noon, but they were already 5 or 6 tables occupied already.   My friends ordered their chicken salads and I ordered the wrap chicken sandwich with soup.  After waiting for 30 minutes, we were still waiting and finally were able to get the attention of our waiter who went back to check on the status of our order.  He came back with the salads but said they had run out of chicken and had to cook more.  And we were among the first customers for the day.  He did offer to make it up with free soup.  What was exasperating was that the table next to us had received a chicken sandwich earlier.  About 10 minutes later, the waiter came back out with my chicken sandwich, apologizing profusely and said it was compliments of the house free.   So at least I had a free lunch, but I had to take it out to be able to get back to the office in time.  Oh, the chicken sandwich was okay, but I didn't enjoy it having to eat it back at the office.

I had high hopes for a new downtown place on my eatery list but I had poor service and felt the restaurant was "dirty" compared to other locations. We waited 15 minutes for the server to take our drink order and she didn't validate my ticket as she said she did so I had to return to the restaurant (so I wouldn't have to pay $28). She also didn't get my order correct (I had substituted a type of pasta). Anyway ... big disappointment (and first) for a CPK.

3 stars because of the terrible service.  This downtown branch of CPK must change! The waiters move s-l-o-w-l-y and whenever you ask them for something, they always forget. If have to ask a couple times for water before it comes. You have to ask them for extra napkins a couple times before it comes, etc. The list goes on. The food is actually missing "something" - I know all of the CPK food is supposed to be the "same", but it always seems like the food is lacking something. Every time I go there, the BBQ Chicken Pizza dough isn't as good or fluffy or tasty as it is at other locations.  The parking is bad. It's in downtown, so I assume they get all their money from the businessmen who work downtown. So those guys just walk there. But if you're coming in your car,
this cpk is one of the best - in terms of service and speed.   Made me a fan -

It's overpriced mediocre pizza. The pizza has NEVER been outstanding. Only "Eh", "Decent", "Ok", or "Good".  Terrible service. Prepare to wait a long time to get your food.  Sadly, I lived 2 blocks from here, and my ex-roommate LOVED CPK. It would be her last meal, if humanely possible. So I was forced to come here a lot. :( I would rather grab a slice from Pizza Next Door!

I spent $12.00 for 10 ravioli - no salad, no soup - nothing.  Just a bowl of ravioli plopped in front of me.  I finally asked for some bread, which I was told is "upon request".  In other words, they're too cheap to just offer it.  When it came, it was the cheapest french bread there is and it was stale on top of that.  The ravioli was decent, but this is way overpriced for what you get.

Classic CPK.  It's so hard to eat here at lunch.  You need a reservation or a long lunch hour to wait for a table.  The waiter I encountered last time I ate here was extremely nice and helpful.   If you've never eaten at a CPK, get the spinach dip and use the bread they give you rather than the chips.  You will thank me later.

I went to the CPk at the Wells Fargo building last week because I was doing some business down there. I have to say the the service was excellent and the food was really tasty......I had the Pasta with meat sauce which I have never had there ......and it hit the spot. It's nice to know that I can enjoy more than the Pizza's and Salads. Good job CPK!

I detest CPK, but late nights at work and limited dinner options make it unavoidable.  The food is pedestrian, but meets my low expectations.  What is troubling is this location's inability to take an order and provide the meal that I ordered.  I get a special preparation to avoid the mountains of salt and oil that they put in their pastas, as well as to add a few particular items. Numerous times, this location has omitted elements of my order.  The worst was tonight.  As always, I provide the order to the phone operator and then ask that person to repeat it back to me.  We went through that process to get on the same page.  What do I end up with?  A basic marinara pasta.  Morons, go listen to the recorded order at around 7 PM tonight and tell me how what I ordered equates to a spaghetti marinara.  I will have no choice but to return to this place, but urge others to stay away.

We'll go with 3 stars here.   It was the second time I had eaten at this Downtown CPK.  Coming in from the wet and rainy day that was December 18th, I figured, "hey guys, lets just go here its close and dry." That is what we did. Little did I know, I would get stuck in the same section as last time, but the service was also slow.  Our waiter was rather pleasant nonethless, but he was the table stalker type.  Lurking around just close enough to be seen, but never actualy coming over unless he noticed we were ready to pay or wanted to order more.  Granted, I'm a big fan of the leave me alone table service, but don't STALK my table.  No one likes a peeper who is a bit creepy. The food took  a bit, but was surprisingly decent.  My frenchies liked it anyway.  Desert was fab, full of ice cream and warm cinnamonny apples.   ITs really only worth it if you go after the Finance crowd has moved on to their happy hour.  Otherwise you might have to wait.  Tis great for the rainy day though.

CPK is always good. This one is walking distance from the Westin Bonaventure so I go there when I'm staying at the Westin. My standard fare at CPK varies between the wedge or the Waldorf salads; the BBQ chicken, the Margherita, or the garlic chicken pizzas; and the lava cake ala mode or the apple crisp ala mode. Can't go wrong with any of those options.

I was shooting a video in the Art district, so we decided to get some food from CPK, the their meals that are supposed to feed 8 to 10 people is more like feeding 4. So food was good, just not cost effective.
Did I mention that I like the Spaghetti Pizza?  That one is fun to eat!  This one has some weird seating and the service was a bit slow.

Alright, lets lay out the entire situation, just as it was...   So we were staying downtown and participating in the fun time they call the LA marathon, so there were tons and tons of people, it was a Sunday night, the night b4 the event and mind you there are very few places open in this part of downtown on a Sunday....   This place is a chain, (- 1 star sorry )                              BUT EVERYTHING ELSE ROCKED!  There were 7 billion people waiting to be seated (give or take a few thousand) the wait time was 30-35 minutes OR no wait time for the windy patio, we were STARVING and had a bigger party, so we said hey lets sit in the cold!Once we were seated they fired up some lovely outside heater lamps and all was good in the hood, half my face got toasty it was great :) We were seated immediatly, greeted promptly and everything was right on point, service, exact orders, and the waiter made sure to stop by every now and then, amongst the billions of people! FAVORITE PART:What I like, is when you say, "can i please have extra veggies" they hear "she really really likes veggies, she must mean eXTRA veggies" and for such a difficult demand my wish was granted... It was great, we will return next race around! High five guys!
Pricy, small, flavorless pizza.

i would only eat here if someone at work was buying and that's unless we have some OT project.. the food is nothing special, Jambalaya and pizza are too expensive for what you get if we got to choose what to have for dinner when we have OT it would be really hard to pass up Denny's...and i don't really like denny's...so what does it say about CPK? really not worth it!! spend your money elsewhere

Pretty fancy pizzeria! Me and my friend wanted to get some slices to bring home, but entered through the wrong door, where immediately attacked by a waiter who sat us down and gave us a three course dinner. Somehow we ended up with two drinks, one Cosmopolitan and one Cactus martini, so i would say the staff is way to good at selling whatever here. watch out!
What happened to this place? Used to be dam good pizza's. Save your money, order from the Pitfire Pizza Company. Far more bang for your buck!

ok, so i'm pretty sure that this is the one i went to. food was decent and the restaurant was clean overall. we were seated in 15 min even though it was definitely the lunch hour rush. the restaurant was definitely crowded and loud, and we were thankful that they sat us at a very personal two person table so that we could hear each other. our waiter was doing the best he could with the million tables he had, and he actually got my acquaintances vegetarian request absolutely correct. my mediterranean chicken sandwich was pretty good and the tortilla soup was delicious. i polished that thing off in 5 minutes flat. -1 star for the service. it was a bit on the slow side and slightly annoying when people got their food before us even though they had sat down after us.

Thank You CPK. Thanks for feeding me and catering late at night. Your Cobb Slalad is awesome. You're bread is great but I don't think I would ever eat one of your pizzas. The pizzas are just too dry but you more than make up for it with the Cobb Salad. Beign one of the few resturant opened late in downtown is definately a plus.
spinach dip is kind of addicting.  the goat cheese pizza with bacon is flippin sweet

I expected some consistency of CPK's because they're all generally ok you know? But I know that if I ever eat at a CPK, i'm never coming to this one again. When I came, it was pretty empty. So we thought at least we'd have quick service. They stuck us in a corner where no one was around. So no servers, waiters, anyone came walking by our area. We waited FOREVER for a server to come. There was another table nearby, and they went to complain because no server came around to them either. We finally ordered. They brought us cold, stale bread to munch on. The water there tasted like it could've come out of the toilet. My friend's water had things floating around in it. So we asked to change it, but again, it wasn't clear. We asked one more time, and guess what? same problem. We didn't want to make any more fuss, so we just shared a glass of water.
Good when you have no idea where to go and you are craving a high calorie pizza or a similarly high calorie sandwich. The quality of the service varies and is unpredictable.
It's a chan resturant, so for me it starts off in the red, but The pizza isn't bad and it is open late. This place and Pastagina are the only two places in the area that I know are open late.

Way too busy, and my server was not on the ball.  In general, I love CPK, but this was too skatterbrained for my taste.  She forgot the bread, we were at a table very very close to another, and all in all, it wasn't the great experience considering I love the chain.

I have reviewed CPK before, I actually like CPK...but the reason why I have always loved it is because of the pear and gorgonzola pizza...it is fantastic...I have been ordering it for years.   This location is across the street from where I work so, the convenience of the location alone makes me frequent it for take out or for a quick lunch.  Last night I met a friend for dinner and didn't even look at the menu......why would I?  I always order the same thing...all of a sudden when we gave our order i suddenly had an out of body experience...holy heck, did the waiter just tell me they stopped carrying that pizza??????  is that really true????  denied the illustrious pear and gorgonzola pizza that i have been ordering for years?????  i was stunned, i needed a few minutes to compose myself and to figure out what else to order.  i actually thought about whether or not to just leave.  i felt like i had just been dumped by a close friend that i had involved with for years or like how i would feel if the White Stripes broke up....OK, I am being dramatic but you get the point....i loved that pizza....ugh, so i settled on some type of tortilla pizza which was good but it paled in comparison to my old friend who was just thrown off the menu and gone to the pizza graveyard.  The tortilla pizza was all mushy cold, not like the my ole dead buddy, he was delicious cold...he never let me down even once. Aside from my pizza trauma, I had a nice time.  It wasn't crowded at all, although just as a heads up it gets insanely crowded here during the day around lunchtime.  The waitstaff is always nice and the service is prompt. except that take out can sometimes take a while though, I have had then tell me it can take up to an hour during the lunch rush.  I did get Paul a pizza to go last night and it came pretty darn quick, before we were even finished eating.   Normally I would give CPK four stars but I just had to deduct a star for throwing my pizza off the menu.

Right next to my apt, it's perfect for walking distance. This place is great. I order ahead and pick up, or I'll walk in with minimal wait time and I am served fast. The service at the pick up area is always great, there is this one lady in particular that does a great job at making me feel welcome by asking if I need anything else (typical, but sometimes it's hard to find).  I usually get the Milan Neopolitan pizza. It has a variety of sausage and meats taht are both sweet and spicy. Thin crust too. I also love their Whaldorf salad (sp?), it's got walnuts, cherries or cranberries, bitter spring mix, blue cheese, it's just a great salad and their half is so big, i couldn't finish it. Also, their pasta was really good one time, it's a penne pesto. the picture made the pasta look green because of the basil, but when my cousin was given his meal, it was more of a wheat color. Kind of unexpected, but the taste was creamy and smooth. Their vietnemese wraps are good too, but it's got kind of a PF Chang flavor, sweet and glossy, so take that with a grain of salt.  Overall, I'm impressed with this location. Clean, up-beat and really bang out some good food. I will continue to come here. Pros: location! consistent food Cons: sometimes server waited a bit too long to come back to us, but probably just busy. PS there is delivery, but it's expensive because they use a service for it.
salads are super fresh esp at the one in Culver City or santa monica. sure it's a chain but still a Cali-fave. waldorf salad - yum

I took my cousin to CPK for a birthday dinner at 7 p.m. on Wednesday night.  They seated us promptly at a table next to the main aisle between the bar, so we asked to be moved to a table outside (it was nice weather) to avoid constant waiter traffic behind us.  The food took a while to come out and they were not that busy.  The food was decent.  The nice thing about pizza is that you pretty much know what to expect and it's hard to go too wrong.  Surprisingly they didn't offer any bread and butter this time (I have been to this CPK 3 or 4 other times) while we waited for our food.  The waiter was cordial and offered to re-fill our waters.  Overall it was a pleasant experience.  I would go back to this place.  One plus about this place is that they have a plasma screen TV and so if you are a sports fan, it's nice to be able to watch the game while you eat.

If you are a CPK fan don't eat here as it will ruin the whole experience for you. I live downtown so usually eat here after the business men have left or on the weekends. As such, you would think the service would improve, and the food would come hot and fresh. The service here is just plain slow. The food doesn't taste anywhere as good as other CPKs. Maybe it's because it comes out cold. But that still doesn't explain why the flavor is lacking so dramatically here. CPk in Pearlridge Mall in Honolulu, HI is my favorite- spinach dip is great and wait staff our friendly.
